title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX)
Interview Descriptions: It was a two-stage process. The interview was simple yet extensive. There were two people in the interview panel. One round was telephonic and another was in person. Prepare your communication skills and read the JD thoroughly.
Interview Questions: Past experience. Education Why do you want to join? What do you expect to gain from the position?

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Phone call was arranged by director and you select time and day. That is all. I don’t have more to say so I can reach the 30 words it says I need.
Interview Questions: Previous Experience that I had

title: Camp Counselor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions: Fun process. There were a lot of team-building games as well as discussions among all applicants. We were split into groups to do this interview Everyone is welcoming and wants you to be there.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to this job

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas State in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: They call you to schedule an interview. Had a zoom call and four people interviewed me. Had to wait a week but got a rejection. Questions were easy, but I think either they like you or they don't as I was very well qualified.
Interview Questions: What are your weaknesses. What are your strengths. Why should we hire you.

title: Dietary Aide Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions: Great and easy to navigate the interview process. Very nice. Very friendly. Yes, so good. Just doing this so I can review other things on this website. Why do I have to do this. Please send help.
Interview Questions: What is you first and last name.

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions: Multi-round interview with key stakeholders  that provided various opportunities to engage throughout the process. The first round included a telephone interview followed by an all-day on-campus interview. Like with many other public institutions, the process can take a long time.
Interview Questions: What interests you about this position?

title: Resident Assistant (RA) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Feb 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was fine, you do a panel interview with two individuals. Can range from RAs to RDs and RAs. They ask you a series of case questions, how you'd respond to certain scenarios etc.
Interview Questions: What would you do if there was an argument between roommates?

title: Productions Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions: Printed resume and cover letter required. Very friendly and relaxed. For a student working position. Explained the job position and requirements very well while giving a tour of the area. Position offered at the end of the interview.
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit for this position?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions: i did a phone interview evacuee of corona, they asked 15 questions. she was really nice and understanding and it lasted about 20 minutes. be prepared for "what would you do in this situation" type questions.
Interview Questions: a lot of scenario based questions

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions: First you fill out an application. After your app is reviewed you'll be notified via email if you've been selected for a group interview. If you've been chosen from the group interviews, you will then have an individual interview with the heads of the OL team/NSO  program.
Interview Questions: Behavioral and situational type questions based on your previous experiences

title: Undergraduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Resume and cover letter was required, in which a panel would then overlook your qualifications. If you got approved, you would move on to the one on one interviews. These interviews would from the head of the lab department. Once this occurs they will contact you back in whether or not you got the position.
Interview Questions: How would working in a lab benefit you in your career? How will it benefit your personal life?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions: It was really great, the interviewers were friendly and knowledgeable. It lasted a good amount of time and I felt comfortable and prepared answering the questions. The interview was in-person and they asked standard questions.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite building on campus?

title: Graduate Instructional Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions:
there are total 3 rounds, If you best in round 1 you will move to round 2 and the same with round 3 as well.
Round 1 - behavioral round with supervisor.
round 2 - programming written test in in-person.
 round 3 - teaching demo on the a given topic.
Interview Questions: Demo will be on the topics like Variables, arrays, functions.

title: Orientation Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: First round of interviews are group interviews where you will be observed on how you work with others. If chosen to move forward, the second round of interviews are one-on-one (with a panel of coordinators and employers)
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you had to make a hard decision in a leadership position

title: Contracts Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas State in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was a total of four people in the interview. They talked about the organization, what they did, and how they meet their goals. They each took turned asking questions during the interview. There was a total of 11 questions. At first, it was a bit intimidating. However, the interview went smooth and lasted around an hour.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself and why you're a good fit in this role.

title: Health Promotion Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Jul 2019
Interview Descriptions: The hr wheels move slowly, but I heard directly from the position supervisor to request a Skype interview and was later contacted for an in person interview. The in person interview was a multiple hour process and involved chatting 1:1 with the director of health promotion, a 1:1 interview with the student health center director, and then a presentation and panel interview with the job search committee and peer education officers.
Interview Questions: How would you handle interpersonal conflict within the peer education group you would be advising?

title: Graduate Instructional Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions:
There were three rounds in the whole process.
The first round was a one to one interview with a supervisor. 
The second round was a coding test.
The third round was a teaching demonstration.
Interview Questions: What do you like about San Marcos?

title: Data Analyst II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Texas State (Corpus Christi, TX) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: They scheduled the interview over the phone but when I got there they were disorganized and said they had to reschedule it.  I had already taken time out of my day to go to this interview, it put a bad taste in my mouth.
Interview Questions: They asked about my background and education.

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions: Strung out the process for over 4+ months with minimal communications. Several rounds of virtual/in person interviews. All interviews were group and/or panels and lasted anywhere from one to two hours.
Interview Questions: Management style, difficulties at work, prior experiences

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy. I had a one on one interview with the main receptionist of the office I was working for. Asked several questions after the interciew to show I was really interested in the position.
Interview Questions: What quote would describe you?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX)
Interview Descriptions: the interview was 1 and 1/2 day long which included teaching; included a research presentation;  group meeting with the tenured faculty, one on one meting school director and the dean.
Interview Questions: information about research agenda; teaching focus; ability to acquire funds and grantsmanship

title: Residential Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: 1 round of interviews with a Residential Director and current Residential Assistant. I was given the questions beforehand. The entire process took about 20 minutes. In addition to the questions, there was a diversity video that you must watch and discuss during the interview.
Interview Questions: Consider an area you feel you most need to improve. What are some actions you have taken in the last year to develop in this area?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was a very easy interview process. The first question asked was about my gpa and then the second question was about my general skills (i.e excel, powerpoint). The hiring process was quick as well. Everything was ready within a week.
Interview Questions: Why I was interested in doing research?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions: Not really tough, They just see if you are good in teaching, because the pre-requisite for applying for that job is that you should have proper knowledge.  Just be confident and it shall work.
Interview Questions:
Why do you want to work with us?
And Some Programming Question

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was very brief with the person of interest, the dean of the subject in question and the head secretary. It lasted 15 minutes only. They did not ask very many unique questions, just the generic interview ones.
Interview Questions: Where I will be in five years

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: It was brief, relaxed, and quite informal. A professor recommended me, so when I got to the interview process, I am assuming they were pretty much ready to hire me. It is not a difficult position to get if you are a great students, have good grades, and know a professor who can give you a recommendation.
Interview Questions: They went through my resume and asked me questions about my past jobs

title: Faculty Member Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Presentation to current faculty and department chair; one on one interview with department chair; one on one interview with dean; campus tour; introductions to current faculty and staff who were not in attendance at presentation.
Interview Questions: What are your personal and professional goals?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX)
Interview Descriptions: I sent my cv, a letter of interest and transcripts. I was contacted to schedule a phone interview. I later traveled to campus to interview with faculty, interview with department chair, interview with dean, do a job talk, meet with students.
Interview Questions: who are some of the researchers or theorist that influence your work

title: Mail Carrier Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and got a call to set up a in person interview. The interview process was very straight forward and easy. I interviewed with the manager and started working within a week.
Interview Questions: Pretty basic questions: Why are you applying for this job?

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with two people, seemed very personable and interested in my background.  Interview lasted roughly an hour, the conference room used was slightly intimidating but had a great view.
Interview Questions: Besides your work history, what can you tell me about yourself?

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process to become a Resident Assistant when I interviewed was two rounds of 1-hour interviews. I loved it! Each interview was with two people in housing, one RD and one current RA
Interview Questions: What does diversity mean to you?

title: Accountant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview was relatively usual for an Accounting position. Typical interview questions with a group, past experiences, technical experience, where you see yourself. After, there was a 3 part reconciliation and a general knowledge test. Hiring process takes about 3 weeks, two weeks for interviews and a week or so for approvals. After they make their decision, it has to go through various offices and a background check before they offer.
Interview Questions: Can you describe your technical experiences, experiences with databases, etc.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Oct 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process itself was easy. I applied for a writing position, and I was called in less than a week after submitting my application and writing samples. I was not asked any behavioral questions during my interview -- only the basic "tell us about yourself" and what ever other questions came to mind on the spot.
Interview Questions: What kind of position would you like to see yourself in (after completing graduate studies)?

title: User Service Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted for about 30 minutes. There were 5 people took turn to ask questions. Questions were pretty easy. Had a tour of the department at the end. It took 2 weeks to be notified the results.
Interview Questions: Describe what is a best costumer service?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Submitted application, resume, cover letter, and official transcripts. This was combined with academic performance in undergraduate and graduate studies to create a holistic representation of skills. No interview was required for this position. Was notified of position offer via email. Training started 3 weeks later.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Instructional Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Not so much a one on one interview. Many different documents were submitted (transcripts, reference letters, personal statements) so that a committee could make choices on who would receive a position (basically funding during masters program).
Interview Questions: Asked to write a personal statement for a committee

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied through the school website. I received a call in a couple of days.  The interview was set and there was  3 person  Director, assistant to Director, and current GA. After a week later, I received a call from the department and got hired.
Interview Questions: Asked a couple of questions regarding what motivates me? The interview took 30-45 mins.

title: Academic Advisor I - College of Education Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions:
I categorized the interview as “difficult” not because of the content of the questions, but because of the interview time limit and the parking situation. 

When applying for this job, I had a recent Master's Degree in education from TXST, a reference letter from a current education professor at TXST, and 14 years' worth of experience in education. I applied online using their cumbersome application process on 1/21/16. The following week 2/28/16, I got a call and a follow up email to interview on 2/1/16. 

A word of caution about parking: make sure to be on campus at least an hour before your interview time. As a former student, I knew exactly where to park and knew the building location. I just had to find the office location. I arrived 45 minutes ahead of time and the parking employee told me that they hadn't reserved a visitors' spot. WHAT?! The email clearly told me to park in the visitors' spot! The parking guard gave me a visitors' pass so I wouldn't get towed, but said I was not allowed to park in the visitors' spot. WHAT?! So, I wasted at least 30 minutes of my time circling the parking lot trying to find a spot and running across said parking lot back to the darn building. I then spent about 10 minutes climbing stairs and trying to find the correct office. If I had known I wasn't going to be able to use a visitors' spot, I would have arrived earlier. I barely made my interview time. I normally like to be there 15 minutes early and felt this incident could have adversely effected my chances for this job. 

The biggest challenge during the interview was the time limit. They claimed interview times were limited to 30 minutes to mimic the time/experience the advisor has with students. It was incredibly difficult to cram a discussion of my extensive experience into just 30 minutes. I ended up using graphic organizers inside a PowerPoint presentation. It was well received. I interviewed with three women: the department chair, an advisor, and a supervising advisor. Everyone was pleasant and polite, but it was very rushed and I don't feel that any of us got the information we needed. They wanted to know why I was coming back to TXST to work instead of teaching. (I fail to see why that was even an issue.) I explained that as part of my private tutoring business I advised high school students prepping for college and enjoyed it. I wanted to take those skills to the college level. I blinked, the interview was over, and I was being shoved out the door. As I left, I was told that I should hear back from HR in about two weeks. 

I was very eager to hear back from TXST and emailed the interviewer on 2/8/16. She told me the position had been filled and I was crushed. I followed-up and requested advice/tips for my next interview. (I was fishing for a reason why I wasn't hired. I was clearly qualified for the position.) She replied with some generic answer that didn't make any sense. After reading a recent review posted to Glassdoor, I think this was another case of nepotism. What a waste of my time!
Interview Questions: General/generic questions

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: I received a mass email through our office of student advancement that there was an opening for a part time graduate assistant. Further instruction told me to contact the manager for the opening. From there I communicated via email, then phone, and eventually in person for the opening position. Where upon I was offered the job. It took about a half of a month before I got hired from the initial email I sent back showing interest in the job.
Interview Questions: What is your experience working in this kind of field.

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was asked the basic interview questions as well as serval questions about the position I was applying for. I was also asked for my current classes and the college path I had planned on taking.
Interview Questions: Hour Availability

title: IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Ultra disorganized. I applied online. Got a call for job X, to show up at 2:00pm on said day. Confirmed it twice on the phone. I showed up 30 minutes early, and the front desk admin said Job X was actually for different job Y, similar but not the same title. Was informed that interview for Job Y was a different day. I said there must be a mistake. Then proceeded to wait about 20 minutes while they figured it out. Eventually they figured out that Job X and Job Y are the same, with different titles. Got called in for the interview. Met with a panel of 4 very nice people. The interview went great. I was told to fill out a background check form, and would hear back in a week or so. 2 weeks later I have called and emailed only to receive open ended responses. 3 weeks later I've pretty much given up all hope. And i REALLY wanted this job. Now I am being cornered into taking a job that pay less and is with a bad employer. I'll keep looking everyday until I get something better.
Interview Questions: Describe strengths and weaknesses, etc

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Oct 2015
Interview Descriptions: Applications for employment are submitted online. In order to get an interview, you must include how you meet all the "required qualifications" in your resume and cover letter. A matrix is used to assess how you stack up against other applicants and the top candidates are called for an interview.
Interview Questions: Mainly behavioral questions such as "Describe a time when..."

title: Student Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions: I came in to interview with both the manager of the office and the students that were already working there. It was very casual. I showed them a range of work I'd done and they asked me questions about my process and what I like about design.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite typeface?

title: Microcomputer Lab Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions: Phyllis, Amanda, and Sam were included in the interview process. At the time, they were the head, and two assistants, Sam being more of a technical assistant and Amanda being more administrative. The questions asked were pretty standard. I did not find the interview to be difficult. After the interview, we had a big "getting to know you" event, where we played ice-breakers games and met the other student employees.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in five years?

title: Front Office Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: There wasn't any interview process for me. They knew my face and knew I was involved in the music ensembles. I had continuously asked for a job, and they were happy to give me a job in the front office. I had to constantly ask and email the front office at the end and beginning of semester to see if there was an opening. I had to do a lot of paper work including my driver's license, social security card, and an voided check to set up my direct-pay.
Interview Questions: What's your availability?

title: Videographer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I Applied on Jobs4Cats. I met the office managers on the 4th floor of LBJ. The interview was 20 minutes long. I got to know the managers and we talked about my video production history, as well as what the job entailed and focused on.
Interview Questions: What software and equipment are you most comfortable with?

title: Verbal Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: I interview with three employees in the SLAC lab. They asked a series of questions relating to the job. There was also a grammar and writing test. One portion consisted of correcting grammar mistakes in sentences. The second portion was writing a one page basic essay.
Interview Questions: How familiar are you with citation styles?

title: Graduate Instructional Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: There was 3 rounds, first round is with the hiring person he tests our communication skills, second round is completely on presentation skills, I was given a topic and was asked to present the topic and final round is technical round, hiring person himself took interview in this round and tested technical skills.
Interview Questions: why are you interested in this position

title: Supplemental Instruction Leader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: Simple interview process where you essentially have to talk about how you would communicate with students that are having difficulties in and outside of class. Since the role deals with helping students that are likely to fail a course, the questions during the interview focus on how you communicate with others and how you prioritize school and grades and also your ability to utilize the school's various resources.
Interview Questions: Give a presentation on how you would talk to student that is at risk of failing a course

title: Lab Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was fairly simple; I showed my previous work and my credentials. I was asked questions about the work and it was explained what I would be doing in the lab. Since I was already acquainted with the interviewer, it was fairly informal.
Interview Questions: What are some of the projects you have worked on in the past?

title: Evening Reference and Instruction Librarian Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (Round Rock, TX) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: Initial phone contact was very professional, inviting me to interview. I had a standard panel interview with three library employees. Basic academic librarianship questions asked in a lackluster robotic manner was the first red flag, with one interviewer constantly and feverishly writing notes hardly ever looking up. I should have politely excused myself, knowing right then and there this was not a good fit as the professionalism took a nosedive thereafter! Over more casual conversation at lunch, I began to realize that I had been called in simply as a required second candidate due to university red tape requirements for interviewing a minimum of two persons for any position. I doubt I had a genuine chance as, in their minds, they already had the person they wished for the job. (In other words, they used me simply as a second body to hire someone else!) To me, this is a huge waste of time, resources and money on all sides. When I was given the chance at the end to ask my own questions, I first thanked them all for the opportunity to interview, and tactfully asked the question "What about me drew you to invite me to interview for the position?" The interviewer who eventually responded could not even look me in the eye and muttered something incoherent. I'm still unsure to this day as to what they attempted to say. Further, I even had to show myself out as this individual suddenly became "too busy" to walk me out. Most bizarre interview I've ever had! University policy states that the hiring manager is to contact all candidates interviewed as to the hiring decision. Despite having sent thank you correspondence to each person with whom I interviewed, I was never contacted by anyone at Texas State as to the status of my application. I found out online that the position was filled. Very unprofessional followup.
Interview Questions: What do you know about project management?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was thorough but straightforward. I interviewed in person with a small panel first, then moved to a one-on-one interview with the supervisor immediately afterward. I was called back within a week or two.
Interview Questions: Most of the questions were behavioral, such as "describe a time when you had to resolve a conflict."

title: Grant Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions:
Pre-Hiring process: Online application required as well as resume, cover letter, Microsoft Excel skills test. The website was easy to navigate and use.  The application took a few hours to complete; uploading my resume and other required documents was simple. 
Interview process: l received a phone call about a week after the closing date of the job posting asking if I was still interested, if I wanted to be interviewed and to set up taking the Excel test.  The test was set for later that week.  Once they got my score, the interview was set up for the following week.  I was notified at the end of the day of my interview that they would like to offer me the position. I said I would like to accept.
Hiring Process:  They can only offer the position pending positive results of a background check, which took about a week.  The office of equity and access also has to review the methods used by the office to make sure they followed the proper rules and procedures.  Once all of this was vetted and I was cleared, I started the job 2 weeks later.
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult or unexpected was asked during my interview.

title: Client Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was a phone interview and then a hands-on interview. It was a bit nerve-wrecking because you unexpectedly get an anonymous phone call and are asked technical questions on the spot. If you have very minimal computer knowledge and skills, it can feel a bit overwhelming. They want to see your effort in trying to trouble shoot as well as your communication skills.
Interview Questions: If a computer freezes and nothing is working, how would you fix it?

title: Legislative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Texas State (Austin, TX) in Nov 2014
Interview Descriptions: It went well. We both talked about the job descriptions and everything that goes on in the office. explained the correspondence of the job and what the senator wants in me. overall it was a great interview and a great learning experience of the whole situation.
Interview Questions: what my ambition are.

title: Maintenance Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted my email to come in as I had been selected for a face to face interview with the department of maintenance. Little did I know I would be surrounded by 8 people at a long table all of whom had questions on their tablet to ask. After the interview i was told I would be contacted within 10 days to let me know if I got the job. Needless to say I got a rejection letter. Perhaps I had more experience than they were looking for.
Interview Questions: What does the color orange mean ?

title: Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: Video interview at first level screen, in-person interview with professional presentation to work team, and reference checks. It also included a lunch when I was still being interviewed by future team members.
Interview Questions: Tell us how you seek to understand others when you have not lived their life experiences.

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions:
a phone call, emailing, and in-person interview after applied. average paced process flow. 
After I got a presentation with ideas, they gave an explanation the facilities. if I know their facilities, i could get a better presentation.
Interview Questions: what do you want to do for your researching? what's your connection?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with the head of the lecture halls through a referral, and we had a very short, easy going interview, where she asked if I had experience working with technology. Then I got a tour of the facility and a mini lesson on how to operate the equipment depending on what the person using the theater will require.
Interview Questions: Have you ever had experience in event planning?

title: Processing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions:
The overall interview process was simple and quick. I applied and got a call a few days later to set up a time for an interview. Got offered the job on the spot and filled paperwork the same day. I started 2 days later. 
Prior to the interview, I had to complete a data entry test at the HR office in the JCK building on campus.
Interview Questions: Describe what great customer service means to you

title: Engraver Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: Very quick hiring process. Applied through Jobs4Cats and heard within a week. Sent in my resume, had the interview and heard back from them later that day with an offer.
Interview Questions: Just the regular run-of-the-mill questions. Why do you want this job? Describe a time when you had to show leadership? Etc.

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Discussion of previous experiences, classroom management, experience with topics. Their was also conversation about previous employees we both knew and a tour of the facilities. Very friendly conversation and atmosphere.
Interview Questions: Why I want to teach

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Informal with several members of the department. No unexpected questions.  Lots of discussion of experience with specific Texas State processes and software. Relaxed atmosphere.  Very willing to answer my questions regarding the position.
Interview Questions: Standard type

title: Teacher's Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions: Talk to professor and see if you can assist them!
Interview Questions: Interview process was very simple!

title: Administrative Assistant I- Registrar's Office Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and interviewed a little over a month later. Panel interview of 4, business casual. Nice folks and they liked to joke around. Mostly typical questions like "Why did you apply?" and "How do you respond to stress?" I was told that a decision would be made at the end of the week and then all applicants would be informed of the outcome. That was three months ago and still no word. That happened last time I interviewed here too. Guess they don't feel the need to actually follow up with the losers.
Interview Questions: They did some "got-cha" questions like "What is the fastest way to select an entire table in Excel?" and "How do you use filters in Excel?" I would recommend brushing up on MS Office, just in case.

title: Information/Reservations Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX)
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was a breeze, asked simple get to know you questions. Student oriented work style, meaning your manager were students just like you.
Interview Questions: Get to know you questions, major? When do you graduate? What your interest are?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: They asked me several questions. The questions were about my background, my experience, my hobbies, my strengths and weaknesses, different scenarios to solve, and so on. At the end, they asked me if I had any questions.
Interview Questions: What was one of my weaknesses?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas State (Baltimore, MD) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview at national conference for my professional organization. The interview team consisted of just two members of the department. They did not seem to be coordinated with respect to how they would perform the interview. Nor where they on the same page with respect to answering my questions. This was particularly true with respect to timelines for advancement for advanced assistant professors.
Interview Questions: The questions were not difficult at all. The interviewers seem unfocused and not truly committed to the process. The follow up after the interview was abysmal.

title: Adjunct Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions: There was not an interview process, as I worked as a Teaching Assistant here while pursuing my advanced degree. That process was fairly rigorous, but do not feel it is relevant to this experience. In terms of hiring, I expressed interest in teaching full time after I graduated and was initially told there were no available positions. After finding employment elsewhere (for a similarly low salary), I was eventually offered a full-time position two weeks before the beginning of the fall semester.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Instructional Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Before each semester, there will be some availability for the GIA position. You just fill out the application form online and then submit it. Later you will receive some confirmation letter and ask you for a short interview. You should bring your resume together with the unofficial transcript, and they just ask some brief questions about Object Oriented Programming, C++, data structure, etc. Then, you may get hired!
Interview Questions: Nothing difficult for this kind of job.

title: Testing Center Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas State
Interview Descriptions: This was a wonderful and easy interview. I felt comfortable and supported.
Interview Questions: What would your coworkers say is your weakness?

title: Cashier- Parking Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Typing test with one 3 min. warm up and then a 5 min. test. Required to make 35 WPM. Hiring Panel of 5. Business Casual. Interview lasted about 45 min. It was not really difficult, but it does seem like much ado about what is essentially a cashier position. I applied in early Jan., was interviewed in mid- Feb., and then I was told that it may be up to 4 weeks before I hear any news. It is a long process.
Interview Questions: What is diversity and why is it important?

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied and was called within a few days. Was then scheduled for an interview during the week and was let know about the job the following Monday.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: there were 3 interviews on campus from different departments. They were mainly looking for people with more time on their hands but  they did not state this until later. They saw my schedule was overwhelmed with activities so I could not qualify for  this position. However, they were good connections to meet with.
Interview Questions: how do you manage your time while being a student and an assistant?

title: Grant Senior Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Sept 2012
Interview Descriptions: Group interview with Dept Chair and faculty.  Was contacted to come interview with the department chair, the grant manager and the faculty involved with the grant involved with this position.  After the group interview I waited about a week and was offered the job.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience planning large meetings and conferences.

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is literally picking a professor and asking if they have any research opportunities.  It really isn't much more than that except filing some paperwork when they give you the yes to go ahead.  Just be confident that the person you want to work for is actually worth working for.
Interview Questions: What are your interests in the field of computer science?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Face to face interview. Three people panel. Questions related to the job.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Instructional Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: One Face to Face interview. regarding programming skills, databases,operating systems, management skills, networking skills.
Interview Questions: About Hardware

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of two panel/group interviews on separate days as well as a typing, writing and Microsoft Excel test.  The group interviews were held with three people - the office coordinator, the Assistant Director and the Director.  It would have only been one group interview, but the Director was out sick on the day of my first interview, so I was called back in for a second interview to meet with her and the rest of the panel.
Interview Questions: What are three adjectives that describe you?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Very Casual usually works if you have had a few classes with the Professor. Honestly there really was no interview I just recommend taking a few classes and be passionate about the subject your Professor teaches.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Lead Web Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: I met the team I would be working with, who asked me several questions related to mostly open source technologies to see my willingness to learn and/or my ability to lead projects using technologies that are not proprietary. Each person took turns asking 2-3 pages worth of questions about my favorite programming language, how I work, and what type of environment I do well in. I also had the opportunity to present my portfolio and demonstrate the results of my work. They said they would contact me within a week. I was interviewed on a Tuesday, and they contact me the Friday of the following week offering the position.
Interview Questions: What's the most difficult thing to do in your favorite programming language?

title: Child Care Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: I initially applied online and then came in for the in-person interview. I am a college student and was surprised by the level of professionalism at this child care center....a cut above the rest for sure.
Interview Questions: Have you ever worked with children and do you understand the developmental stages?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions: Online Application
Interview Questions: Questions related to your past experience

title: Lecturer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in May 2010
Interview Descriptions: Gave a presentation on how I would teach the students.
Interview Questions: Why are you leaving your current job?

title: Web Development QA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: I went through an ordinary on-line process for application; quite a few pages that resulted in the equivalent of a resume with full work history, not very elegant but all right.  After this I was contacted by email and given an interview date and a programming challenge or test to complete beforehand.  The test was about programming approach plus unit testing; suitable for assessing skills, and fun.  There was no feedback about this afterward.  The interview was with 5 people who went round, each giving me a question.  The atmosphere was relaxed and friendly.  Questions were ice-breaker/personal (light, of course), skills, temperament and work style, sense of one's own strengths and weaknesses.  I received a good impression of the ethics, morale and savvy of this team.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite web application?

title: Writer/Editor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Texas State (San Marcos, TX) in Mar 2009
Interview Descriptions: It took a long time between the submission of the application and when I was contacted for an interview. The interview was soon afterward, though. The interview was with the entire staff of 12 people, with each asking one question, and then the director asking more.
Interview Questions: I was asked how my job experience would translate to education.

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Texas State in Jan 2007
Interview Descriptions:
The recruiter call me and ask me about my resume, he then asked for a 1:1 interview. 

The 1:1 interview took place a few days later, in it I had to explain previews projects and give an example of my past experiences (show a website or a system I had developed).

The call me a few days later for another interview with some general questions about my hour flexibility and requirements (software, hardware etc) then they offer me the job
Interview Questions: Tell me about a past work experience. Describe it fully.
